page.title: 02River Fruin, Geology, Arden
page.content: The River Fruin runs through the area. Long ago a glacier ran down Glen Fruin, now the river has taken its place. There are two sand and gravel quarries beside the Fruin. One is at Dumfin which is not worked at present. The other is at the mouth of the Fruin. This one is being worked and produces high quality sand which is used for concrete. It employs about 20 men. There are many different kinds of stones to be found on the shores of Loch Lomond near the mouth of the Fruin. They are - sandstone, quartz, granite, slate, mica schist and conglomerate. Fishing is a popular pastime in the area. Salmon and sea trout are caught in Loch Lomond and the Fruin.
